evidence_span: the in-reactor posttransition corrosion rate in the PWR is a simple multiplicative factor of the ex-reactor posttransition corrosion rate

evidence_span: the acceleration constant is inversely proportional to the corrosion temperature

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_031_chunk9
evidence_span: the maximum acceleration is associated with the maximum posttransition fast flux exposure and the least acceleration with the minimum posttransition fast flux exposure

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_031_chunk9
evidence_span: the acceleration factor $( A )$ is of the form $\pmb { A } = \pmb { B } \left( \pmb { \emptyset } \right) ^ { b }$ where Ø is the posttransition fast flux $( \mathsf { n } / \mathsf { c m } ^ { 2 } { \cdot } \mathsf { s } )$
